Context:
The School of English as a Second Language at George Brown College offers flexible program options including full-time and part-time courses for improving English language skills and preparing for post-secondary study and employment. They have an English for Academic Purposes Program and various student life events and activities to provide a Canadian college experience. Part-time programs are available with different options depending on English language needs. Newcomers can develop language and communication skills for specific occupations and sectors, which is offered for free in Ontario. Approximately 70% of School of English as a Second Language graduates go on to a diploma or degree program at George Brown College. Students can choose from various learning options based on their needs and schedule. Extracurricular workshops are available with topics that may change depending on availability and demand.

Programs offered: English language programs, full-time courses, part-time courses, English for Academic Purposes Program
Campus location: Toronto, Canada
Student support team contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca
Social media hub link: [Visit Our Social Media Hub](javascript:void(0);)
Application deadlines and college news updates sign up link: Sign Up Now
Land acknowledgment information available.

Note: The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice, it should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty, and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
